name: Sell Your Soul to the Devil Eggs
author: evian257
summary: There are two kinds of deviled eggs, sweet or savory; mine are the sweet variety. They always seem to be the first dish to disappear at any gathering I bring them to. My Grandma taught me this recipe forty years ago, and it's remained basically unchanged. If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®)
directions: Place the eggs in a saucepan in a single layer with enough water to cover by 1 inch
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat
Once the water is boiling, remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes
Pour out the hot water, then cool the eggs under cold running water
Dry the eggs thoroughly with paper towels, and slice them in half lengthwise
Remove the yolks, and place in a bowl
Mash the yolks with a fork, and stir in the sugar, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, and white pepper
Add the mustard, mayonnaise, salad dressing, and vinegar, one at a time, stirring to incorporate each ingredient before adding the next
Mound a heaping teaspoonful of the yolk mixture into the cavity of each egg half, and sprinkle with paprika
